overview: David Heller has extensive deal making and fundraising experience in Asia. He practiced law for five years at the law firm Wakabayashi & Watanabe, Tokyo, Japan. In Israel, he was a partner in the law firm Yossi Avraham & Co. where he specialized in M&A transactions and was also responsible for Asia-related deals. Prior to joining Vertex Venture Capital, Mr. Heller co-founded and raised capital for the first Israeli venture capital fund tailored for Japanese corporate investors - The Israel International Funds (IIF). At Vertex, in addition to executing investments and divestments, Mr. Heller led the capital raising from Japanese and Taiwanese investors for Vertex II and is responsible for business development activities for the Vertex portfolio companies in Japan. Mr. Heller is a member of the Board of Directors of the Israel-Japan Chamber of Commerce. He has been a member of The Israel Bar since 1985. Mr. Heller earned an LL.B from the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Israel and an LL.M from Kyoto University, Japan.
